instructions: In Find My iPhone on iCloud.com, tap All Devices, then select the device you want to play a sound on. If you don t see All Devices, it s because you ve already selected a device. Tap the name of the current device in the center of the toolbar to access the Devices list, then select a new device. Tap Play Sound. If the device is online , a sound starts after a short delay and gradually increases in volume, then plays for about 2 minutes. A Find My [ device ] alert also appears on the device s screen. If the device is offline , the sound plays the next time it connects to a Wi-Fi or cellular network.

In Find My iPhone on iCloud.com, tap All Devices, then select your AirPods. If you don t see All Devices, it s because you ve already selected a device. Tap the name of the current device in the center of the toolbar to access the Devices list, then select a new device. Tap Play Sound. If your AirPods are online , they play a sound immediately (for 2 minutes). If they re offline , you receive a notification the next time your AirPods are in range of your iPhone, iPad, or iPod touch. Important: Make sure to remove the AirPods from your ears before playing a sound. Although the sound starts playing softly, the volume gradually increases. This could cause discomfort for anyone wearing the AirPods. If your AirPods are separated, tap Mute Left or Mute Right to find them one at a time.
